results.title: Fearless: the Hunterwali story
results.creator_credit: Riyad Vinci Wadia and Wadia Movietone
results.brief_description: This documentary traces the life of Australian born actress Mary Evans who performed in numerous Indian films of the 1930s and 1940s under the alluring nom-de-plume Fearless Nadia. With her buxom physique, blonde hair and blue eyes Nadia’s roles typically showed her displaying incredible strength and fortitude in the face of marauding forces and wicked villains. Her roles included “Hunterwali” (1935), “Diamond Queen” (1940), “Jungle Princess” (1942), “Tigress” (1948) and “Jungle Queen” (1956), among others. Nadia challenged the traditionally submissive roles played by women in Indian cinema and performed many amazing and dangerous stunts required for the action and swashbuckling genres in which she extensively worked. J.B.H. Wadia (1901-86), a frequent collaborator of Nadia’s, became a master of adventure films as a successful director and producer along with his brother Homi. Features extensive interviews with Fearless Nadia reminiscing upon her life in the cinema; intrepid stuntman and actor John Cavas (aka Cawas) who worked extensively with Nadia; as well as several other Indian filmmaker contemporaries of Nadia. Numerous clips from Nadia’s oeuvre are shown alongside explanations of dangerous stunt work and co-ordination, and technical developments in cinema. With English subtitles.

constellations_other.name: Fearless women
constellations_other.description: Australian born Fearless Nadia would skyrocket to Bollywood fame in her first leading role as Princess Madhuri / the caped crusader herself Hunterwali. Translated in English as a Woman with a whip, Nadia delighted audiences with her daring stunts and circus skills.

results.title: Mortal thoughts
results.creator_credit: Alan Rudolph, Mark Tarlov, John Fiedler, Joseph Caracciolo Jr, Rufglen Films, Polar Film and New Visions Pictures
results.brief_description: Cynthia and Joyce are childhood friends who get involved in the gruesome death of Joyce’s abusive husband in a moment of passion. The two conspire to cover up the crime, which leads to an intricate web of lies and a cycle of accusations and double-crossings. Alan Rudolph plays out this neo-noir drama within a working class milieu, replete with New Jersey accents and drab surrounds. Demi Moore and Glenne Headly are two hairdressers caught between the loyalties that their lifelong friendship demands and the terror of being accused of murder. Headly gives an absorbing performance as Joyce, a woman trapped in an impoverished, miserable state with an overbearing, insensitive, drunkard of a husband. Harvey Keitel plays a hard-boiled detective who unravels the mystery of James’ death by interrogating Cynthia, who reveals the past through a series of extensive flashbacks.

results.title: Sneakers
results.creator_credit: Phil Alden Robinson, Lindsley Lindsley Parsons, Walter Parkes, Lawrence Lasker and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Martin Bishop heads an organisation of computer hackers, technology experts, reformed thieves and outsiders who are paid to break into high-security institutions in order to prove their vulnerability. Several shady characters approach Martin to steal an electronic code-breaker that is a risk to national security. Against his instincts Martin accepts the assignment when they threaten to expose his true identity. Naturally nothing goes to plan, and the friends find themselves in peril when they realise the decoder’s awesome potential for destruction. What transpires is a thriller entailing conspiracy theories, double-crossings, a corrupt government and murder. “Sneakers” is quite amusing and, at times, somewhat fraught with tension, as the team battle a myriad of forces. Pre-dating the late 1990s, early 2000s paranoid computer-hacker films, “Sneakers” has a sprightliness that impresses and despite an overabundance of contrivances, makes for a satisfying caper. Top cast includes Robert Redford, Sidney Poitier, Ben Kingsley, Dan Ackroyd, Mary McDonnell, River Phoenix and David Strathairn.

results.title: Wolf
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Douglas Wick and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Publisher Will Randall - recently retrenched and replaced by younger, sycophant protegee Stewart (James Spader) - notices strange behaviour after a wolf at full moon bites him. The behaviour involves a heightening of the senses and rejuvinates his lagging demeanor, turning him into a younger version of himself. The metamorphosis reaches full flight at the next half moon when he takes a moonlit wander and awakes in the morning covered in blood and unaware of his actions. Medical science is unable to find an answer to his symptoms, however Dr Vijay Alezias (Om Puri) tells Will he is assuming the characteristics of a werewolf, the crucial point being that Randall can only change if he already possesses the animal instinct. He finds a sympathetic ear to his predicament from his former employer’s beautiful young daughter Laura (Michelle Pfeiffer), whom he is entrusted with protecting after Stewart joins him as a werewolf but doesn’t have the love of a good woman to quell his animal appetite. A hirsute love story, part comedy, part horror, the cast also includes Christopher Plummer, Prunella Scales, Kate Nelligan and David Hyde Pierce and features an impressive gothic mise-en-scene and evocation of the New York publishing scene.

results.title: Jason and the Argonauts [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Don Chaffey, Charles H. Schneer and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Stemming from Greek mythology, this is the tale of the voyages of the intrepid Jason and his Argonauts on a quest to find the legendary Golden Fleece. He and his crew must brave all manner of dangers and face a host of terrifying foes, including the seven-headed Hydra, fighting skeletons, bloodthirsty Harpies and the invincible colossus Talos. It is also a tale of love, as the beautiful Medea risks everything for Jason and his quest. For its time, the special effects of Ray Harryhausen were given accolades by the critics. Stars Todd Armstrong as Jason and Nancy Kovack as Medea.

constellations_other.name: Sublime light and special effects
constellations_other.description: Explore 19th-century artist John Martin’s surprising influence on science fiction and fantasy films of the 20th century, from Jason and the Argonauts to the Lord of the Rings and the Evil Dead franchises.

results.title: Loser [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Amy Heckerling, Twink Caplan and Columbia Pictures Industries
results.brief_description: Fresh from the success of “Clueless”, Amy Heckerling (Fast times at Ridgemont High) dived into the life of the nerd in “Loser.” Jason Biggs (American Pie) is Paul Tanneck, a good-natured Mid Western teenager who wins a university scholarship and moves to New York City. Naively confident in his signature ear flap hat, Paul is thrust into campus life with 3 despicable drug addicted and brattish room mates who have nothing but contempt for him but are not adverse to asking favours when it suits them. He meets a soul mate in Literature class in Dora Diamond (Mena Suvari), a fellow outsider who appears to be operating on his wavelength. Following an alcohol drenched party hosted by his now ex-room mates at his new abode, Paul discovers Dora unconscious in the bathroom and takes her to the hospital. The two spend a few nights together while Dora recovers from having her stomach pumped and the two prove to be compatible. When Paul discovers Dora is having an affair with Literature’s Professor Alcott (Greg Kinnear), he withdraws his attentions from her even though he can see through the philandering professor that Dora blithely dotes on. “Loser” is populated with caricatured college stereotypes and behaviour that borders on depressing rather than amusing, however the outcome is transparent, so you know the character flogging will abate.

results.title: The Big hit [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Che-Kirk Wong, Wesley Snipes, Warren Zide and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Mark Wahlberg stars as an anxiety ridden killer for hire who is part of an elite team of hitmen (made up of Lou Diamond Philips, Antonio Sabato Jr. and Bokeem Woodbine) in this violent action comedy. Wahlberg’s chaotic domestic life and stressful blood soaked professional life come unstuck when the kidnapping of a wealthy businessman’s daughter has major repercussions for the band of killers. From its fetishistic reconstruction of the code and conduct of organized crime, right down to its casual, flippant depictions of violence, “The Big hit” owes a lot to the films of Quentin Tarantino (which are in themselves pastiches of various European and American filmmakers). However the spectre of the Hong Kong action film hangs over them all (“The Big hit” goes as far as enlisting Hong Kong action director Che-Kirk Wong and the executive producer is the legendary John Woo), a cinema that is wonderfully inventive with its own form of genre splicing and indirect homage. Cast also includes Christina Applegate, Elliot Gould, Laine Kazan and Avery Brooks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Che-Kirk Wong, Wesley Snipes, Warren Zide and Tri-Star Pictures

results.title: Body double [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Brian De Palma’s “Body double” - like most of his body of work - are genre exercises which borrow and pay homage to the films of Alfred Hitchcock. The Hitchcock template for this film is “Rear window” and “Vertigo”, perversely reworked into a lurid, violent thriller which proudly wears all it’s sleazy excesses on its sleeve. Craig Wassen plays Jake, a down on his luck actor who has just been fired from a shlock Z-grade vampire film due to his claustrophobia, a problem considering he spends several scenes inside a coffin. Dumped by his girlfriend and evicted from his flat, Jake finds himself homeless until a fellow actor (Gregg Henry) suggests he temporarily house-sit a rich record producer’s house. One of the perks of house-sitting he soon discovers is the sexy neighbour (Deborah Shelton) across the road who loves to undress in front of her window. Soon Jake finds himself obsessively spying on his mysterious neighbour as he inadvertently becomes embroiled in a nasty murder plot. Cast includes Melanie Griffith, Guy Boyd, Dennis Franz.

results.title: The Cable guy [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ben Stiller, Judd Apatow, Jeffrey A. Mueller, Andrew Licht and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: After being dumped by girlfriend Robin (Leslie Mann), Steven Kovacs (Matthew Broderick) moves house and into his life enters Cable Guy Chip Douglas (Jim Carrey); a dry, wise cracking tradesman with a speech impediment who is keen to pursue a relationship that goes beyond that of client and service provider. Their outings initially consist of a trip to the cable satellite but progresses to dinner dates and (stolen) gifts. After a frightening basketball game in which Chip replaces one of their players, Steven sees the dark undertones emerging in Chip and begins to fear the intensity of the friendship. When he starts interfering with his relationship to Robin (including beating up one of her dates in a bathroom), Steven wants out, but the entertainment and technology savvy Douglas is proving hard to shake. Jim Carrey throws himself into the role of the Cable Guy, at times hilarious, but always verging on malevolent; as a consequence, the black humour reflects the film’s ambivalent exploration of the genre and content matter, thus giving it a comedy/thriller tag. Director Stiller features in a sub plot played out on the television screen of a former child star accused of killing his twin. Cameos by: Andy Dick, Janeane Garafalo, Kathy Griffin, Eric Roberts, Owen Wilson.

results.title: The Caine mutiny [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Edward Dmytryk, Stanley Kramer and SGS Corporation
results.brief_description: Captain Queeg (Humphrey Bogart) takes over command of the run down, rusty minesweeper the “U.S.S. Caine” and immediately orders changes to the running of the vessel, against the instincts of the crew and officers. Slowly the changes and restrictions take on a more ominous form as the Captain is seen to be mentally unstable and endangering the lives of his crew with an adherence to order over reason. Told from the perspective of young and idealistic Graduate Ensign Willie Keith (Robert Francis), appointed ship’s Morale Officer by Queeg, but is one of two officers court martialled facing mutiny after they relieve Queeg of his duties when his steadfast adherence to rules imperils the lives of his crew in a typhoon. Nominated for 8 Academy Awards and based on the 1951 Pulitzer Prize winning novel by Herman Wouk. Cast includes: Jose Ferrer, Van Johnson, Fred MacMurray.
